title: KURTZ, AnnaBelle Dec 30, 1928 - Dec 23, 2023
text:
Born on Dec. 30, 1928, in McKean, Pa., AnnaBelle Kurtz peacefully passed away on Dec. 23, 2023, at CVPH in Plattsburgh. She was 94 years old. AnnaBelle was a beloved wife, mother, grandmother, great-grandmother, and friend, leaving behind a legacy of love and cherished memories.
AnnaBelle was preceded in death by her devoted husband of 72 years, Alfred H. Kurtz, her parents, and her sisters. She was also preceded by her son-in-law, Joel Harwood. Her passing has left a void in the hearts of all who knew her.
She is survived by her children, Peter (Carolyn) Kurtz of Lake Placid, Barbara (Joel) Harwood of Lewis, and Anna (Reginald) Whitney of Keene. AnnaBelle was a doting grandmother to her grandchildren, Paige (George) Saltamach of Elizabethtown, Clare Harwood of Rochester, Hugh Harwood of Lewis, Hanna Whitney of Rotterdam, and Emily Whitney of Keene. She also had the joy of being a great-grandmother to Henry and Etta Saltamach, both of Elizabethtown.
AnnaBelle's family meant everything to her, and her grandchildren were her greatest gifts. She was known for her love of sewing, crafting, reading, and solving puzzles. AnnaBelle had a passion for storytelling and would captivate those around her with her vivid narratives.
A long-standing member of the United Church of Christ in Elizabethtown, AnnaBelle found solace and strength in her faith throughout her life. Her dedication to her church community was an inspiration to all who knew her.
To honor AnnaBelle's remarkable life, a Visitation will be held on Jan. 6, 2024, at the United Congregational Church of Christ in Elizabethtown at 1 p.m., followed by a Memorial Service at 2 p.m.; burial will follow at the Essex County Veteran's Cemetery.
As we gather to celebrate the extraordinary life of AnnaBelle Kurtz, we remember her kindness, warmth, and unwavering love. May her spirit continue to guide us and her memory forever be a blessing.
Services were entrusted to Heidrick Funeral Home, Elizabethtown, N.Y.

Plant a tree: How does it work
When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.
An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.
After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.
Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.
Tree Planting Timeline
Orders placed in:
January - May
Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.
June - December
Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
